website_summaries.verdict: A great book for those with no background or training in graphic design who want to get started.
pros: Goes over the basics about graphic design, including designing with color, designing with type, and tips for designing specific projects like newsletters, brochures, and flyers
Information is presented in a way that is easy to understand
cons: This is not a book for those who already have a basic understanding of graphic design

customer_reviews.title: Great Book Novice Graphic Designing
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome book. The author clearly builds on proper design principles using outstanding examples of poorly and properly designed bulletins, personal stationary, postcards, resumes, etc. Although I have been using Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign (formerly Pagemaker for years), I have a lot to learn about graphic design. Considerable emphasis is placed on the focus for the particular design followed by four easily understood design principles. The last one-half of the book concerns use of type. The book does not and should not teach specific brand-name computer applications. This is one great book. Seriously. I highly recommend the book to any beginner or low intermediate designer. Thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: I learned oodles from this book
customer_reviews.text: If you need to do graphic design and are not professionally trained, buy this book and read it. It was a fast, easy read with lots of before/after pictures to illustrate applying the principles she teaches. My own work has improved dramatically after doing this work. I was a competent amateur, but now what I'm producing looks better, and I have the words to explain how and why it is better. This book was worth every penny, and it's not particularly expensive to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: A design book about text but not images
customer_reviews.text: This is a book about good design principles for communicating with text, and toward that end it is certainly very informative, and even enjoyable to read. There is a great deal of useful information in here about typography, color, and organization. However, the book treats images only as decorations, rather than as alternative means of conveying information. So it does not address the design of media that rely on text and graphics alike to get a message across. Further, if there is a fifth edition, I hope it will also include some discussion of the use of typography and color that work well for people with color vision deficiency and other visual challenges.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Semken

customer_reviews.title: Great book on graphic design basics
customer_reviews.text: As someone prepping for a continuing ed design program, I wanted to get my hands on some basic knowledge of graphic design. This book is exactly what I needed, and covers the principles of design in short, sweet, and accurate detail. Coming from a more technical background I appreciate how succinct this book is and clearly lays out the point and purpose of what you need to accomplish. You won't come away as a design master from this book, but it is a wonderful intro to the field of graphic design principles and I would highly recommend it for newbies, or those simply interested in learning graphic design principles for their own personal projects.

customer_reviews.title: Practical information that gets you directly from basic concepts to production
customer_reviews.text: I'm a technical writer in my day job, which, in today's business environment, means I also do all the editing, graphic design, and layout. for the projects I work on. I've picked up enough design and typography technique over the years to have figured out a good deal of what the author explains. But this book puts all the bits together in a coherent whole, labels the principles systematically (which is a big help for memory), then adds whole new dimensions of tasty tips. The exercises and mini-quizzes make sure you get all the important points, including the tiny, subtle ones. Well worthwhile.

customer_reviews.title: excellent and readable overview
customer_reviews.text: This well-written and engaging book covers key concepts in real world design pieces very well. It is clear and provides good examples of what works and what doesn't. Good for beginners or practitioners to get a fresh perspective or brush up on basics.
customer_reviews.author: lisa smith

customer_reviews.title: This is a great book for anyone looking to start or get better ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book for anyone looking to start or get better at making attractive designs. A must-have for any beginner, this book is genuinely fun to read and quite helpful, with a memorable acronym guiding the text. Worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G

customer_reviews.title: A great read!
customer_reviews.text: This book was required for my graphic design class in college and I really enjoyed reading it. It is well written and easy to understand.
